result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on January 25, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Telephone conference on November 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.
NOH  10/14/22 Status Conf
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 08:45 am.

3:19 PM Defendant John N Penworth appeared by phone.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John N Penworth.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jakobson explains the situation that has came up recently. Attorney Jakobson is requesting an adjournment to do further investigation. Attorney Lambert is okay with allowing Attorney Jakobson to adjourn this to do more investigation. Court grants the request to adjourn this matter.
Motion to Adjourn
State's Checklist
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

11:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John N Penworth in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John N Penworth. Defendant appears. Warrant is cancelled.

Defendant is requesting a jury trial.  Atty McGrath places the offer on the record.  Defendant rejects the offer.

10:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John N Penworth not in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John N Penworth.  

Warrant ordered.  Body only.

11:02 AM Defendant John N Penworth in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John N Penworth.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin.  Lt Kevin Hamill is sworn and questioned by Attorney McGrath.  Testifies to being dispatched to a residence regarding an alleged assault. Testifies to speaking with the victim.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies that Officer Kizer spoke to the defendant.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jakobson.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
